statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Texas-Arlington 110, Texas State 103
article.story: SAN MARCOS, Texas (AP) -- Brandon Long scored 26 points, and Rodrick Epps had 17 of his 19 points in the second half as Texas-Arlington defeated Texas State 110-103 Saturday. Epps scored 12 points in a 23-5 second-half run that put Texas-Arlington (8-14, 3-6 Southland Conference) ahead for good. Dylan Moseley had 23 points for Texas State (8-14, 3-6) and Brent Holder added 18. Texas State scored the first 12 points after halftime to take a 60-53 lead. The Bobcats still led 82-76 with 9:06 left. Epps keyed the Mavericks' surge with a 3-pointer, then followed with a 3-point play to tie the game at 84. Epps added six more free throws in the run. Texas State hit 16 3-pointers, including six from Holder, and Texas-Arlington had 11. The teams combined to attempt 56 3-pointers. Larry Posey had 18 points, Anthony Vereen added 16 and Roger Guignard had 12 for the Mavericks. Texas State's Brandon Thomas and Antwoine Blanchard each scored 14.
